    Just 27 Products From Etsy You Just Gotta Check Out

    Gather round and feast your eyes on this can of bath spaghetti.

    by Rebecca O'Connell

    BuzzFeed Staff

    Hey, you! C'mere a sec. I have some cool stuff from Etsy to show you. I'm talking cowboy chicken earrings, a butterfly side table, and medieval cat stickers. 

    1. A roll-on perfume, from the chic perfumer Lucky Cloud, in creative scents like Moon Palace (cedar, leather, moonlight), Green Smoke (rosemary, white sage, salt air), and Tea Ceremony (green tea, mango ginger, honey). Reviewers love how long-lasting the fragrances are! 

    Lucky Cloud Perfume / Etsy

    Lucky Cloud Perfume is a small business that sells synthetic-free, vegan fragrances made in small batches with botanicals. 

    Promising review: "This smells so good, unlike anything I’ve ever smelled." —Devyn

    Get it from Lucky Cloud Perfume for $36 (available in six scents). 

    2. A handmade, laser-engraved butterfly plant stand/side table to elevate your plants or decor to new soaring heights. You can pick the stain of the wood to best match your style. 

    Wood & Soil

    Wood & Soil sells a variety of cute furniture for plants from Washington. 

    Promising review: "I absolutely LOVE THIS!!!!! The craftsmanship ship is so very beautiful!! I just adore it!" —texasprincesscdb

    Get it from Wood & Soil for $95+ (available in four sizes and six colors).

    3. A mini cat tag in case your lil' Houdini slips out the door again. In a world with so many stray cats, this can help them stand out as a pet in need of assistance.

    CoveLeather / Etsy

    CoveLeather is a small business that sells pet supplies. 

    Promising review: "It's so tiny and cute; I love that it doesn't take up so much space on my kitty's collar so she doesn't feel overburdened by tags." —Oran

    Get it from CoveLeather for $8+ (available in three styles and two colors).

    4. A purrfectly adorable ceramic coffee spoon sure to impress guests at your next tea time. Compliments on your cute display? Sweeter than two lumps of sugar.  

    Oraorahome / Etsy

    Oraorahome is a small business based in Toronto that sells curated home decor.  

    Promising review: "Adorably crafted for anyone who loves their tea and kitties." —Lauren Rose

    Get it from Oraorahome for $13.58 (available in five colors). 

    5. A Keith Haring-style Smiling Friends tee worth waiting eight hours in line for. Luckily, unlike the NYC pop-up, there's no line for this amazing find — but you DO have to wait for it to arrive.  

    IcedAffinity / Etsy

    IcedAffinity is a small business that sells cool products for animation lovers.

    Promising review: "Fabric is comfortable, and the image is very clear. Got it for a friend and I think he will LOVE it." —Kayla

    Get it from IcedAffinity for $25+ (available in unisex sizes M–2XL and two colors). 

    6. A lil' tin with breakfast inside! JK, it's lip balm packed with beeswax and candedilla wax to help make lips softer than a gently poached egg.  

    Filipinta Beauty / Etsy

    Filipinta Beauty was started by illustrator Hana Kirchhoff. Filipinta is a combination of the words "Filipina" and "pinta," roughly translating to "face paint for Filipinas."

    Get it from Filipinta Beauty for $12. 

    7. A Gummy Venus de Milo patch so you can recreate the classic Simpsons scene on your own behind. Rest assured, no drooling Homers will be a part of this. 

    Disco Ghoul LA / Etsy

    Disco Ghoul LA is a small business that sells embroidered patches. 

    Promising review: "Amazing, I love it! ;)" —barcelonix

    Get it from Disco Ghoul LA for $9.99.  

    8. A book lamp that fits neatly onto your bookshelf so you don't have to worry about mounting, electrical work, or other tiresome chores that aren't cuddling up with a book. The linen-shaded lamp comes with a long, 8-inch cord that you can easily snake through the back of your bookcase.

    Literary Lamps / Etsy

    Check out this TikTok and watch this lamp book seamlessly blend in with the bookshelf.

    Literary Lamps is based in Broussard, Louisiana. They have the lamp available with several different covers to best fit your home's aesthetic.

    Promising review: "Not only is this lamp extraordinarily beautiful, but the seller was beyond helpful when I needed the size customized because my bookshelf’s shelves weren’t tall enough to accommodate the listed book size. I literally just bought another one today for my other bookshelf! Truly cannot recommend this product and the seller enough!" —McKenna Barry

    Get it from Literary Lamps for $149.99 (available in two styles).

    9. A magical Disney sun catcher to make your home the happiest place on Earth — because rainbows = happiness, duh.

    Wish Upon Magic / Etsy

    Wish Upon Magic is a Disney-themed small gift shop. 

    Promising review: "I am obsessed with this little window cling. It makes the best rainbows all day long!" —Nicole

    Get it from Wish Upon Magic for $11.99.

    10. A pair of suede Mary Janes with fuzzy lining for anyone who wishes they could wear their clogs year-round but requires a little more insulation. Wear them inside or out, with socks or bare feet — the world's your slipper!

    Gor Shoes / Etsy

    They're made with genuine leather and an orthopedic insole that features arch support. If you'd like to change the color, material, sole, or add some details, DM the seller. 

    Gor shoes is a small business based in Ukraine that sells unique footwear.

    Get it from Gor Shoes for $177.11 (available in women's sizes 36–41). 

    11. Nostalgic bath pearls for anyone who misses taking a truly fun bath. Throw a couple into your tub, put on "Candy" by Mandy Moore, and recapture some '90s magic. 

    Bare Boutique / Etsy

    Bare Boutique is a small business based in the UK.

    Promising review: "I love these pearls! So nostalgic and also leaves my skin feeling amazing!" —Maria

    Get a bag of 30 from Bare Boutique for $16.83.

    12. A cottage teabag organizer that's sooo much cuter than leaving a bunch of cardboard boxes in your cupboard. There's even the option to pick a cute character for the window! 

    Tabla Handmade / Etsy

    You can fit a box of teabags in the house. The fenced-in yard offers space for extra bags, creamers, or other accouterments. Tabla Handmade is a small business that makes gifts in Southern California.  

    Promising review: "Absolutely adorable teabag holder. It’s beautifully finished. I love it!" —dmdstv43

    Get it from Tabla Handmade for $29.99+ (available in three finishes and four window characters). 

    13. A mini brass ruler keychain so you're never left wondering how tall a bud vase is or if Stuart Little's car is the regulation 6 centimeters away from the mouse fire hydrant. 

    CJMgifts / Etsy

    CJMgifts is run by Jimmy Chen in Dongguan, China.

    Promising review: "Seems to be high quality and has a nice weight to it." —Beatrice

    Get it from CJMgifts on Etsy for $5.86.

    14. A cute poster of a handful of pool balls to add a pop of color to your room. The use of negative space really makes this piece special, IMO! 

    PinkTigerGifts / Etsy

    PinkTigerGifts is a Colorado-based small business that sells posters of the owner's own paintings. 

    Promising review: "Bought this for my daughter's dorm room! She LOVED it! It was delivered quickly, in perfect condition, just as pictured. Thick paper and colors were so vibrant. Would order from them again in a heartbeat!" —Barbara

    Get it from PinkTigerGifts for $17.99 (available in 17 sizes).

    15. A linen couch cover to protect your sofa from The Horrors (cat puke, spilled wine, cookie crumbs) so thoroughly, it'll be like they were never there at all. Minimalist, coastal grandmother lifestyle, here we come. 

    The Linen Valley / Etsy

    The Linen Valley is a family-run, Lithuania–based biz from Raimonda Mor. They source sustainable linen from local manufacturers and create beautiful collections for your bedroom, bathroom, and dining room! 

    Promising review: "Absolutely gorgeous!!!!! Exactly what I was looking for! The quality is amazing. I will absolutely be buying more!!!" —Jennifer

    Get it from The Linen Valley for $129.59+ (available in 5 sizes and 12 colors). 

    16. A stained-glass garland you can hang near a window to treat yourself to a colorful light show when the sun hits. People who love when cool shadows appear on the wall: This one is for you!

    GlasatelierClaire / Etsy

    GlasatelierClaire is based in the Netherlands and sells glass decor. 

    Promising review: "It is so beautiful! I bought this as a gift but wish I could kept it. I’m obsessed with it." —Valerie

    Get it from GlasatelierClaire for $73.14.

    17. A made-to-order ceramic soap dish that'll hook neatly over the side of your sink with a cleverly placed drainage hole to keep things fresh and slime-free. 

    Kim Hau Ceramics / Etsy

    It's made on a pottery wheel, so it takes 4–6 weeks to ship out. Kim Hau makes everything by hand in Colorado.

    Promising review: "I love this soap dish! I bought some handmade soap at a farmers market and wanted a soap dish for it. This one caught my eye because of the sensible drain, the minimalist design, and the matte black glaze." —Linda BInder

    Get it from Kim Hau Ceramics for $45.

    18. A glass butterfly ring to create the illusion that you're a fairy princess who often has sparkly butterflies land on them. 

    Glaze Heart Studio / Etsy

    All rings are size 8. Because these are made by hand, they might look a little different than the photo. Glaze Heart Studio is a small business that sells glass figurines. 

    Promising review: "Simply gorgeous. Fits very well. Thought it might be a little irritating if it caught on things, but it definitely doesn't!" —Liz

    Get it from Glaze Heart Studio for $16.99+ (available in seven colors). 

    19. A pack of medieval cat stickers for anyone who loves a good wonky feline. Amazing how cat memes have existed for thousands of years.

    White Bee Gifts / Etsy

    White Bee Gifts is a small business based in the UK that sells stickers and other stationery. 

    Promising review: "These cats brighten my life significantly. 10/10, all 5 stars, 100% recommend." —megandiamond91

    Get a pack of 12 from White Bee Gifts for $5.27.

    20. A mini globlin figurine that comes in a random style. Will you get the peaceful purple dude or the knife-wielder with the disturbing smile? Each figurine is hand-glued with a hand-painted face. :)  

    Rayne Klar / Etsy

    Rayne Klar is a nonbinary artist from Michigan. 

    Promising review: "I love this little guy; he lives on my desk now." —Stephanie

    Get it from Rayne Klar for $15. 

    21. An AC:NH tree magnet with DETACHABLE fruit so you can harvest them and use them to hang up more stuff on your fridge or locker. You can also order some extra 3D-printed fruit magnets if you have a lot of stuff to keep on your fridge. 

    LunaFormations / Etsy

    LunaFormations is based in Georgia and sells 3D-printed decor. 

    Promising review: "The magnet arrived very quickly, was well-made, and adorable. I am excited to give it as part of an Animal Crossing-themed gift basket birthday present." —Courtney

    Get it from LunaFormations for $3.99+ (available in five fruit versions, multipacks, and with extra fruit). 

    22. A spooky, transparent bookmark that recreates the iconic Psycho shower scene on the pages of your latest horror read. As if Eat, Pray, Love isn't upsetting enough! 

    Imaginaria Co / Etsy

    Imaginaria Co is a small business that sells book-themed gifts and art. 

    Promising review: "The bookmark looks even cooler in person; so happy to have it, would definitely recommend!" —Stacey

    Get it from Imaginaria Co for $9. 

    23. A Plumbob night-light in case you want something to light your way to the bathroom when your bladder needs bar is in the red. The 3D-printed USB crystal just needs a lil' charging cube and you can start radiating good vibes.

    TheBuildPlate / Etsy

    Promising review: "I'm so happy I ordered these lights. They are such a neat gift. Thank you." —Sacha

    Get it from TheBuildPlate for $5.28+ (available in three sizes and 10 colors). 

    24. A coffee mug featuring the Seinfeld gang in the episode when they got lost in the parking garage. RIP Elaine's goldfish. 

    Michael Ramstead Art / Etsy

    Michael Ramstead Art is a small business that sells illustrated goods.  

    Promising review: "I love it! What a wonderful design. This would make a great gift for any fan of the show." —Joe

    Get it from Michael Ramstead Art for $14.95+ (available in two sizes). 

    25. A pair of cowboy chicken earrings with some great, flashy boots. Bob your head to make them do a lil' square dance. 

    Eclectika Designs Shop / Etsy

    Eclectika Designs Shop is run by Vianey Flores in Illinois. They sell clay accessories shaped like chickens, llamas, and abstract shapes. They also make cowboy chicken pins.

    Promising review: "Amazing! Super cute and stylish; wore them today and got amazing compliments. 😊 Def going to order from this shop again! Thank you so much!" —Rachel

    Get them from Eclectika Designs Shop for $26 (available in 11 colors).

    26. Bath spaghetti so you can feel like a lil' meatball swimming in a tub of marinara. If only you had this as a kid! Don't worry; this unique body wash doesn't smell like tomato sauce — instead, expect zesty orange and grapefruit. 

    Paper Plane / Etsy

    It's made with shea butter, olive oil, and coconut oil. Just grab a pinch and rub it over wet skin. Paper Plane sells cute gag gifts from the UK. 

    Promising review: "This is such a fun idea! It smells as good as it looks, plus I love that you can play with it and not get in trouble for playing with your food. ;) Definitely recommend!" —Amaya

    Get it from Paper Plane for $13.98.

    27. A pasta box keychain with lil' bowties you can shake around. A perfect accessory for anyone who plans on ordering noodles with butter at the restaurant later. 

    Octobits / Etsy

    Octobits sells video game- and food-inspired keychains and stickers.

    Promising review: "Great item, good quality, and just like the images! Love it!" —Amanda

    Get it from Octobits for $13.

    Why Trust BuzzFeed Shopping?

    BuzzFeed Shopping is service journalism first: our writers and editors spend all day shopping so you don’t have to, vetting products, fact-checking brand claims, and surfacing what actually helps in real life. We center readers over revenue, recommend products with authenticity (using real experiences, not ad-speak), and reflect our diverse audience, inclusive of a variety of price points, people, and needs. We cut through fake deals, favor useful info over glossy fluff, and recommend both budget and splurge options with context so you can decide what’s right for you — and still have a little fun along the way.

    Rebecca O'Connell is a BuzzFeed Shopping editor with over 10 years of experience finding and vetting new products, having personally tested hundreds of products, sifted through tens of thousands of consumer reviews, and met with countless brands to expand her breadth of recommendations. 

    Reviews have been edited for length and/or clarity.
